question:
Match the state of matter with its property:
(a) Solid - (1) Fixed shape and volume
(b) Liquid - (2) Fixed volume, no fixed shape
(c) Gas - (3) No fixed shape or volume

Match the temperature scale with its absolute zero value:
(a) Celsius - (1) -273.15°C
(b) Fahrenheit - (2) -459.67°F
(c) Kelvin - (3) 0 K

Match the process with the phase change:
(a) Melting - (1) Solid to liquid
(b) Sublimation - (2) Solid to gas
(c) Condensation - (3) Gas to liquid

Match the laws with their relationships:
(a) Boyle’s Law - (1) P ∝ 1/V
(b) Charles’s Law - (2) V ∝ T
(c) Gay-Lussac’s Law - (3) P ∝ T

Match the substance with its melting point:
(a) Lead - (1) 327°C
(b) Copper - (2) 1083°C
(c) Mercury - (3) -39°C

Match the states of matter with an example:
(a) Plasma - (1) Neon gas in tube
(b) BEC - (2) Supercooled gas
(c) Gas - (3) Steam

Match the gas law with its condition:
(a) Boyle’s Law - (1) Constant Temperature
(b) Charles’s Law - (2) Constant Pressure
(c) Gay-Lussac’s Law - (3) Constant Volume

Match the thermometer type with its use:
(a) Clinical - (1) Human body temperature
(b) Laboratory - (2) 10°C to 110°C range
(c) Digital - (3) Mercury-free readings

Match the physical quantity with its unit:
(a) Pressure - (1) Pascal
(b) Temperature - (2) Kelvin
(c) Heat Capacity - (3) J/kg°C

Match the term with its definition:
(a) Latent heat of fusion - (1) Heat to melt solid
(b) Latent heat of vaporization - (2) Heat to convert liquid to gas
(c) Specific heat capacity - (3) Heat to raise 1°C per kg
